LevelHandling

Class MazeStack

  • java.lang.Object
    • LevelHandling.MazeStack

  • public class MazeStack
extends java.lang.Object
    The MazeStack Class defines a stack of Maze Objects: one column in the maze.
    Author:
    Tom Hogervorst

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MazeStack(float x, float z)
      Creates a new stack at the given location. the stack always has a bottom.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void add(MazeObject mzObj)
      Adds a maze object to the top of the stack.
      java.util.ArrayList<MazeObject> get()
      Gets all elements in the stack.
      MazeObject getAtHeight(float height)
      Returns the lowest MazeObject in the array that has its lowest point under the given height and its highest point above the given height.
      float getHeight()
      Returns the highest point in the stack.
      MazeObject getInstanceOf(MazeObject that)
      Gets the instance of a MazeObject in the stack that of the same kind as the given one.
      MazeObject getTop()
      Gets the top Object in the stack.
      void pop()
      Removes the top element of the stack.
      void remove(MazeObject mzObj)
      Removes one MazeObject of a certain kind from the stack.
      void removeRedundantFaces(MazeStack that)
      Removes redundant faces that the given stack and this stack share.
      void rotateTopX(float z, int angle)
      Rotates the top mazeObject by a certain angley Coordinate around which is rotated is calculated using the height of the top MazeObject
      void rotateTopY(float x, float z, int angle)
      Rotates the top mazeObject by a certain angle
      void rotateTopZ(float x, int angle)
      Rotates the top mazeObject by a certain angle. y Coordinate around which is rotated is calculated using the height of the top MazeObject.
      int size()
      Returns the number of Objects in the stack.
      static MazeStack standard(float x, float z)
      Returns a standard stack that is used in an empty maze

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • MazeStack

        public MazeStack(float x,
         float z)
        Creates a new stack at the given location. the stack always has a bottom.
        Parameters:
        x - x coordinate of the stack
        z - z coordinate of the stack

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public void add(MazeObject mzObj)
        Adds a maze object to the top of the stack. If the previous top object of the stack had no height, it is removed. Any Top face of the previous top object is disabled, preventing two or more faces being drawn on the same place.
        Parameters:
        mzObj - The MazeObject to be added.

      • pop

        public void pop()
        Removes the top element of the stack.

      • get

        public java.util.ArrayList<MazeObject> get()
        Gets all elements in the stack.
        Returns:
        The arraylist of Maze Objects in the stack

      • getHeight

        public float getHeight()
        Returns the highest point in the stack.
        Returns:
        highest point of the top Object in the stack

      • size

        public int size()
        Returns the number of Objects in the stack.
        Returns:
        Number of objects in the stack.

      • getAtHeight

        public MazeObject getAtHeight(float height)
        Returns the lowest MazeObject in the array that has its lowest point under the given height and its highest point above the given height. Null is returned when the stack is lower that the given height.
        Parameters:
        height - Height at which the MazeObject is requested
        Returns:
        MazeObject of on the given height, if it exists.

      • getTop

        public MazeObject getTop()
        Gets the top Object in the stack.
        Returns:
        MazeObject at the top of the stack.

      • remove

        public void remove(MazeObject mzObj)
        Removes one MazeObject of a certain kind from the stack.
        Parameters:
        mzObj - MazeObject type to be removed.

      • getInstanceOf

        public MazeObject getInstanceOf(MazeObject that)
        Gets the instance of a MazeObject in the stack that of the same kind as the given one.
        Parameters:
        that - Kind of MazeObject to be returned
        Returns:
        MazeObject of the given type in the stack, else returns null

      • rotateTopX

        public void rotateTopX(float z,
              int angle)
        Rotates the top mazeObject by a certain angley Coordinate around which is rotated is calculated using the height of the top MazeObject
        Parameters:
        z - Z coordinate around which is rotated
        angle - angle with which is to be rotated

      • rotateTopY

        public void rotateTopY(float x,
              float z,
              int angle)
        Rotates the top mazeObject by a certain angle
        Parameters:
        x - X coordinate around which is rotated
        z - Z coordinate around which is rotated
        angle - angle with which is to be rotated

      • rotateTopZ

        public void rotateTopZ(float x,
              int angle)
        Rotates the top mazeObject by a certain angle. y Coordinate around which is rotated is calculated using the height of the top MazeObject.
        Parameters:
        x - X coordinate around which is rotated
        angle - angle with which is rotated

      • removeRedundantFaces

        public void removeRedundantFaces(MazeStack that)
        Removes redundant faces that the given stack and this stack share. Also redundant faces inside this stack itself are removed.
        Parameters:
        that - MazeStack that is checked with this to remove all redundant faces.

      • standard

        public static MazeStack standard(float x,
                 float z)
        Returns a standard stack that is used in an empty maze
        Parameters:
        x - x coordinate of the stack
        z - z coordinate of the stack
        Returns:
        standard MazeStack
